info.title: Airweave
info.description:
## API Groups
This API spec only includes the following API groups:
- **Sources**: API endpoints for discovering available data source connectors and their configuration requirements
- **Collections**: API endpoints for managing collections - logical groups of data sources that provide unified search capabilities
- **Source Connections**: API endpoints for managing live connections to data sources. Source connections are the actual configured instances that Airweave uses to sync data from your apps and databases, transforming it into searchable, structured information within collections

get.description:
List all available data source connectors.

Returns the complete catalog of source types that Airweave can connect to.

available_sources.summary: List of all available data source connectors

post.description:
Create a new collection.

The newly created collection is initially empty and does not contain any data
until you explicitly add source connections to it.

get.description: Retrieve a specific collection by its readable ID.

schema.description: The unique readable identifier of the collection (e.g., 'finance-data-ab123')
schema.title: Readable Id

parameters.description: The unique readable identifier of the collection (e.g., 'finance-data-ab123')

delete.description:
Delete a collection and all associated data.

Permanently removes a collection from your organization including all synced data
from the destination systems. All source connections within this collection
will also be deleted as part of the cleanup process. This action cannot be undone.

parameters.name: readable_id

schema.description: The unique readable identifier of the collection to delete
schema.title: Readable Id

parameters.description: The unique readable identifier of the collection to delete

get.description:
Search across all data sources within the specified collection.

This GET endpoint provides basic search functionality. For advanced filtering
and options, use the POST /search endpoint.

parameters.name: readable_id

schema.description: The unique readable identifier of the collection to search
schema.title: Readable Id

parameters.description: The unique readable identifier of the collection to search

parameters.name: query

schema.description: The search query text to find relevant documents and data
schema.title: Query

parameters.description: The search query text to find relevant documents and data

parameters.name: response_type

schema.description: Format of the response: 'raw' returns search results, 'completion' returns AI-generated answers

parameters.description: Format of the response: 'raw' returns search results, 'completion' returns AI-generated answers

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of results to return
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return

parameters.name: offset

schema.description: Number of results to skip for pagination
schema.title: Offset

parameters.description: Number of results to skip for pagination

parameters.name: recency_bias

schema.description: How much to weigh recency vs similarity (0..1). 0 = no recency effect; 1 = rank by recency only.
schema.title: Recency Bias

parameters.description: How much to weigh recency vs similarity (0..1). 0 = no recency effect; 1 = rank by recency only.

payload.md_content: Implement user authentication - Build secure login system with JWT tokens
Review and update API authentication documentation

post.description:
Advanced search with comprehensive filtering and options.

This endpoint supports:
- Metadata filtering using Qdrant's native filter syntax
- Pagination with offset and limit
- Score threshold filtering
- Query expansion strategies (default: AUTO, generates up to 4 variations)
- Automatic filter extraction from natural language (default: ON)
- LLM-based result reranking (default: ON)

Default behavior:
- Query expansion: ON (AUTO strategy)
- Query interpretation: ON (extracts filters from natural language)
- Reranking: ON (improves relevance using LLM)
- Score threshold: None (no filtering)

To disable features, explicitly set:
- enable_reranking: false
- enable_query_interpretation: false
- expansion_strategy: "no_expansion"

parameters.name: readable_id

schema.description: The unique readable identifier of the collection to search
schema.title: Readable Id

parameters.description: The unique readable identifier of the collection to search

payload.title: Customer Payment Record
payload.content: Monthly subscription payment of $99.00 processed successfully for customer John Doe (john@company.com). Payment method: Visa ending in 4242.

payload.title: Billing Question - Subscription Upgrade
payload.content: Customer inquiry about upgrading from Basic to Pro plan. Customer mentioned they need advanced analytics features.

value.completion:
Based on your recent data:

## Payment Processing
Customer John Doe successfully processed a **$99 monthly subscription payment** on January 15th using a Visa card ending in 4242.

## Customer Support Activity
There was a related support ticket from January 14th where a customer inquired about **upgrading from Basic to Pro plan** for advanced analytics features. This ticket has been resolved.

### Summary
This shows strong customer engagement with your premium offerings, with successful payment processing and interest in higher-tier features.

post.description:
Trigger data synchronization for all source connections in the collection.

The sync jobs run asynchronously in the background, so this endpoint
returns immediately with job details that you can use to track progress. You can
monitor the status of individual data synchronization using the source connection
endpoints.

parameters.name: readable_id

schema.description: The unique readable identifier of the collection to refresh
schema.title: Readable Id

parameters.description: The unique readable identifier of the collection to refresh

schema.title: Response Refresh All Source Connections Collections  Readable Id  Refresh All Post

post.description:
Create a new source connection.

The authentication configuration determines the flow:
- DirectAuthentication: Immediate creation with provided credentials
- OAuthBrowserAuthentication: Returns shell with authentication URL
- OAuthTokenAuthentication: Immediate creation with provided token
- AuthProviderAuthentication: Using external auth provider

BYOC (Bring Your Own Client) is detected when client_id and client_secret
are provided in OAuthBrowserAuthentication.

sync_immediately defaults:
- True for: direct, oauth_token, auth_provider
- False for: oauth_browser, oauth_byoc (these sync after authentication)

get.description: List source connections with minimal fields for performance.
Get a source connection with optional depth expansion.

patch.description:
Update a source connection.

Updateable fields:
- name, description
- config_fields
- cron_schedule
- auth_fields (direct auth only)

delete.description: Delete a source connection and all related data.

post.description:
Trigger a sync run for a source connection.

Runs are always executed through Temporal workflow engine.

get.description: Get sync jobs for a source connection.

schema.title: Response Get Source Connection Jobs Source Connections  Source Connection Id  Jobs Get

post.description:
Cancel a running sync job for a source connection.

This endpoint requests cancellation and marks the job as CANCELLING.
The workflow updates the final status to CANCELLED when it processes
the cancellation request.

status.description:
Current operational status of the collection:
• **NEEDS_SOURCE**: Collection has no authenticated connections, or connections exist but haven't synced yet
• **ACTIVE**: At least one connection has completed a sync or is currently syncing
• **ERROR**: All connections have failed their last sync

Collection.title: Collection
Collection.description:
Complete collection representation returned by the API.

This schema includes all collection metadata plus computed status information
based on the health and state of associated source connections.

name.title: Name
name.description: Human-readable display name for the collection. This appears in the UI and should clearly describe the data contained within (e.g., 'Finance Data').

readable_id.title: Readable Id
readable_id.description: URL-safe unique identifier used in API endpoints. Must contain only lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens. If not provided, it will be automatically generated from the collection name with a random suffix for uniqueness (e.g., 'finance-data-ab123').

CollectionCreate.title: CollectionCreate
CollectionCreate.description:
Schema for creating a new collection.

Collections serve as logical containers for organizing related data sources.
Once created, you can add source connections to populate the collection with data
from various sources like databases, APIs, and file systems.

name.title: Name
name.description: Updated display name for the collection. Must be between 4 and 64 characters.

CollectionUpdate.title: CollectionUpdate
CollectionUpdate.description:
Schema for updating an existing collection.

Only the collection's display name can be updated. The readable_id is immutable
to maintain stable API endpoints and references.

ConfigValues.description:
Config values model.

Implements "flat dictionary" semantics, where no values are dictionaries.

OAuthBrowserAuthentication.title: OAuthBrowserAuthentication
OAuthBrowserAuthentication.description:
OAuth authentication via browser flow.

Supports both OAuth2 and OAuth1 BYOC (Bring Your Own Client):
- OAuth2 BYOC: Provide client_id + client_secret
- OAuth1 BYOC: Provide consumer_key + consumer_secret

OrganizationWithRole.title: OrganizationWithRole
OrganizationWithRole.description: Organization schema with user's role information.

ResponseType.title: ResponseType
ResponseType.description: Response format options for search results.

filter.description: Qdrant native filter for metadata-based filtering

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Maximum number of results to return (DEFAULT: 100)

score_threshold.title: Score Threshold
score_threshold.description: Minimum similarity score threshold (DEFAULT: None - no filtering)

search_method.title: Search Method
search_method.description: Search method to use (DEFAULT: 'hybrid' - combines neural + BM25)

recency_bias.title: Recency Bias
recency_bias.description: How much document age penalizes the similarity score (0..1). 0 = no age penalty (pure similarity); 0.5 = old docs lose up to 50% of their score; 1 = old docs get zero score (pure recency). Applied as: score × (1 - bias + bias × age_factor). Works within top ~10,000 semantic matches. DEFAULT: 0.3

expansion_strategy.description: Query expansion strategy (DEFAULT: 'auto' - generates up to 4 query variations). Options: 'auto', 'llm', 'no_expansion'

enable_reranking.title: Enable Reranking
enable_reranking.description: Enable LLM-based reranking to improve result relevance (DEFAULT: True - enabled, set to False to disable)

enable_query_interpretation.title: Enable Query Interpretation
enable_query_interpretation.description: Enable automatic filter extraction from natural language query (DEFAULT: True - enabled, set to False to disable)

SearchRequest.title: SearchRequest
SearchRequest.description: Comprehensive search request encapsulating all search parameters.

results.title: Results
results.description: Array of search result objects containing the found documents, records, or data entities.

response_type.description: Indicates whether results are raw search matches or AI-generated completions based on the found content.

completion.title: Completion
completion.description: AI-generated natural language answer when response_type is 'completion'. This provides natural language answers to your query based on the content found across your connected data sources.

status.description:
Status of the search operation indicating the quality and availability of results:
• **success**: Search found relevant results matching your query
• **no_relevant_results**: Search completed but found no sufficiently relevant matches
• **no_results**: Search found no results at all, possibly indicating empty collections or very specific queries

SearchResponse.title: SearchResponse
SearchResponse.description: Comprehensive search response containing results and metadata.

payload.md_content: Customer John Doe successfully processed payment of $99 for monthly subscription

This suggests strong customer engagement with your premium offerings.

supports_continuous.title: Supports Continuous
supports_continuous.description: Whether this source supports cursor-based continuous syncing for incremental data extraction. Sources with this capability can track their sync position and resume from where they left off.

auth_fields.description: Schema definition for authentication fields required to connect to this source. Only present for sources using DIRECT authentication. OAuth sources handle authentication through browser flows.

config_fields.description: Schema definition for configuration fields required to customize this source. Describes field types, validation rules, and user interface hints.

supported_auth_providers.title: Supported Auth Providers
supported_auth_providers.description: List of auth provider short names that support this source (e.g., ['composio', 'pipedream']). Computed dynamically for API responses. This field is not stored in the database.

SyncCreate.title: SyncCreate
SyncCreate.description: Schema for creating a Sync object.

SyncDag.title: SyncDag
SyncDag.description:
Schema for a sync DAG definition.

The DAG structure as the UI displays it.

This means that for each entity, there is a node that is the producer and a node that is the
consumer. These are connected by an edge: producer -edge-> entity -edge-> consumer

Sources, transformers, and destinations are also nodes, but they do not have an
entity_definition_id.

Sources are producers by default, and destinations are consumers by default.
Transformers are both producers and consumers.

SyncDagCreate-Input.title: SyncDagCreate
SyncDagCreate-Input.description: Schema for creating a sync DAG definition.

SyncDagCreate-Output.description: Schema for creating a sync DAG definition.

SyncDagUpdate.description: Schema for updating a sync DAG definition.

tags.description: API endpoints for managing collections - logical groups of data sources that provide unified search capabilities

tags.name: source-connections
tags.description: API endpoints for managing live connections to data sources. Source connections are the actual configured instances that Airweave uses to sync data from your apps and databases, transforming it into searchable, structured information within collections
